page.title: 17Education
page.content: In this area of Weymouth and Portland education is arranged in three tiers. Children are allowed to enter school either in September or March depending on the date of their fifth birthday. They will enter either{St.Andrew's {C.E.Primary School, Preston or {Littlemoor Primary School or St.John's {C.E. Primary School, Weymouth. At 11 chidren move on to the second tier, which from September 1985 will be in a Comprehensive School. Four such schools serve the whole distict. The{Wey Valley School}is the local one. At 16 pupils will move into the {Weymouth Tertiary College,}which will serve the whole community. In addition in Preston there is the {Westfield Special School,}which educates pupils with learning difficulties.
